data.title: Need a way to access the font of cocos2d::ui::TextBMFont.
data.body:
_Version_
- 3.8

_Problem_
- We are using cocos studio 2.3.3, ui::Label and ui::LabelBMFont from the cocos studio project are converted into ui::Text and ui::TextBMFont. It's a different project I know but the issue is still in cocos2d-x, since we would need to access the font file of TextBMFont. The getters are there for ui::Text but only the setter is present for ui::TextBMFont, it's probably an omission.

_Question_
- Could we have access to the font file in ui::TextBMFont?

data.title: Fix app-project generates .lib file in Win32
data.body:
I'm sorry I'm not good at express in English well.

When I link my game with cocos2d-x v3.x in Visual C++, they also generate AppName.lib file.
So I analyzed the lib and obj files, it contains the following 4 lines..

/EXPORT:?clone@__Bool@cocos2d@@QBEPAVClonable@2@XZ
/EXPORT:?clone@__Float@cocos2d@@QBEPAVClonable@2@XZ
/EXPORT:?clone@__Double@cocos2d@@QBEPAVClonable@2@XZ
/EXPORT:?clone@__Integer@cocos2d@@QBEPAVClonable@2@XZ

the Demangled name is.. "cocos2d::Clonable\* cocos2d::__Bool::clone() const "
Then I looked the __Bool source code..

"cocos2d::Clonable\* cocos2d::Clonable::clone() const" is pure virtual function..
But the Clonable-derived __Bool class only defined "cocos2d::__Bool\* cocos2d::__Bool::clone() const" doesn't override the Clonable::clone() because return-value is different and virtual" keyword is not specified.
So I just added "virtual" keyword to them, the problems are solved. and then now I added "override" keywords for the coding convention.

data.title: Keyboard fails to hide when the outside area of keyboard is touched while using EditBox on ios 7.1
data.body:
### Context

cocos2d-js version: v3.9
ios verion: 7.1
xcode Version 7.1.1 (7B1005)
### Problem

The keyboard fails to hide when the outside area of keyboard was touched while using EditBox on ios 7.1. It worked in cocos2d-js version v3.8.1.
In terms of code, the `UIEditBoxImplIOS_objc::textFieldShouldEndEditing:` is not called, causing `editBoxReturn` which hides the keyboard not being called.
### How to reproduce

Run the js-test on ios 7.1 and navigate to Extensions Test->EditBoxTest, then touch an edit box, and then touch outside of the keyboard. The keyboard fails to hide.

data.title: update20151124
update
Radial progress widget in UI and CocosStudio editor is needed.
data.body:
Actually, i'ts no a big deal to implement it by myself, using cocos2d::ProgressTimer and make a pull request, but cocos2d::ui::LoadingBar doesn't uses cocos2d::ProgressTimer as renderer, and I think there is a reason - why, although I don't understand it.

Besides that, I need to use this widget in CocosStudio editor, but I don't see a way of doing it. There was some mechanism of making plugins for editor in old versions of CocosStudio, but it seems to be unsupported or removed now. Even if it works, I can't find valid documentation about i'ts usage.

data.title: Can't import custom class/widget ctype into cocos2d-x reader.
data.body:
See https://github.com/darkdukey/Cocos-Studio/issues/75

This is about the node parsing segment that loads flat buffers. As it seems, when loading custom widgets this is always equal to NULL: 

![nulled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8097385/11354597/e94752ea-9209-11e5-9edf-6c5c658fe5b0.PNG)

It doesn't happen with Custom Class nodes, only with custom widgets loaded via the C#/lua method.
